reviews.review_msg: Very knowledgeable, but hard on grading .. I survived
I learned a lot, but he was hard on grading.
Not recommended.  He is not organized and does not speak clearly.
One of the worst teachers I ever had for Kinesiology. Needed to come to his office hours to ask for help and it didn't really work out that well...

This teacher lacks a great deal of credibility among his students and peers. He lacks clear understandings of biomechanics. Students even asked him questions during class that he was unable to answer.
He was potentially a great instructore, though hard and unfair on grading
Class notes were unclear.  He tries his best to help and seems intelligent enough, but can't reason well.  He discusses a topic but tends to go off tangent.
Vague notes & unorganized.  Did not get much out of this class.
Warning.  Now TAing at McGill.  Watch out.  Worst TA and teacher in the world.
He is very helpful and knowledgeable and makes himself available when extra help is needed.
I really loved the course and the teacher was one of the best
HE TRIES his best, but he can't teach. Some people are never meant to be, i suppose. His lectures are not worth going to.

One of the worst teachers I ever had for Kinesiology. Needed to come to his office hours to ask for help and it didn't really work out that well...The average was pretty good but that's because most of the geniuses taking that course were already there for that semester and it totally screwed the others badly...some teacher he turned out to be...
Vague notes. Lectures are useless, go to tutorials. Will put exact examples on tests.
